assignments.a3

Class CellularAutomaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignments.a3.CellularAutomaton

  • public class CellularAutomaton
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple implementation of cellular automaton that determines the next generation of cells by checking if each cell has a certain range of neighbours alive around it in the current generation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CellularAutomaton(int gridSize, double initialProbability, int minNeighbours, int maxNeighbours, int maxGenerations, int modulus, java.lang.String fileName)
      Initializes the initial parameters for the cellular automaton.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean createNextGeneration()
      Replaces the grid with a new one that is created by checking if the old cell should be alive for the next generation.
      void save()
      Appends the current generation to the save file as a grid.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CellularAutomaton

        public CellularAutomaton(int gridSize,
                         double initialProbability,
                         int minNeighbours,
                         int maxNeighbours,
                         int maxGenerations,
                         int modulus,
                         java.lang.String fileName)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initializes the initial parameters for the cellular automaton.
        Parameters:
        gridSize - The number of rows and columns of the cell grid.
        initialProbability - The probability that a cell will not begin alive.
        minNeighbours - The minimum number of neighbours required to be alive for a cell to be alive in the next generation.
        maxNeighbours - The maximum number of neighbours required to be alive for a cell to be alive in the next generation.
        maxGenerations - The maximum number of generations allowed to be generated for this automaton.
        modulus - Determines which generations to append to the file.
        fileName - The name of the file that stores the state of each select generation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If not all parameters are valid values for this implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • createNextGeneration

        public boolean createNextGeneration()
        Replaces the grid with a new one that is created by checking if the old cell should be alive for the next generation.
        Returns:
        Whether another generation can occur or not.

      • save

        public void save()
        Appends the current generation to the save file as a grid. An asterisks signifies an alive cell.
